// src/components/canvas/TextLayer.tsx
import React, { useMemo, useState } from 'react';
import { Group } from 'react-konva';
import { Conversation, ThreadConnection } from '@/types/supabase';
import ThreadCard from './ThreadCard';
import ConnectionLayer from './ConnectionLayer';

interface TextLayerProps {
  conversationState: {
    items: Conversation[];
    positions: Record<string, { x: number; y: number; isCollapsed: boolean; isDragging: boolean }>;
    activeInfoDialog: string | null;
    activeConversation: string | null;
  };
  notebookId: string;
  onToggleInfoDialog: (id: string) => void;
  onToggleCollapse: (id: string) => void;
  onDragStart: (id: string) => void;
  onDragMove: (id: string, x: number, y: number) => void;
  onDragEnd: (id: string) => void;
  onEditContent?: (id: string, text: string) => Promise<void>;
  onContinueThread?: (id: string) => void;
  onCreateFollowUp?: (id: string) => void;
  onCreateReference?: (id: string, targetId?: string) => void;
  setIsModalOpen?: (isOpen: boolean) => void;
  tool?: string; // Current tool (pen, eraser, select, text, pan)
  scale?: number; // Canvas scale
}

const TextLayer: React.FC<TextLayerProps> = ({
  conversationState,
  notebookId,
  onToggleInfoDialog,
  onToggleCollapse,
  onDragStart,
  onDragMove,
  onDragEnd,
  onEditContent,
  onContinueThread,
  onCreateFollowUp,
  onCreateReference,
  setIsModalOpen,
  tool = 'pen',
  scale = 1
}) => {
  // State to track text selection mode
  const [selectionMode, setSelectionMode] = useState(false);

  // Calculate thread connections with memoization
  const connections = useMemo(() => {
    const result: ThreadConnection[] = [];

    conversationState.items.forEach(conv => {
      if (conv.parent_id) {
        result.push({
          fromId: conv.parent_id,
          toId: conv.id,
          type: 'parent-child'
        });
      }
    });

    return result;
  }, [conversationState.items]);

  // Determine if we're in text selection mode (either tool is 'select' or 'text')
  const isTextSelectionEnabled = tool === 'select' || tool === 'text' || selectionMode;

  return (
    <Group
      name="text-layer"
      // Enable text selection when using select/text tools
      listening={true}
    >
      {/* Render connection lines first (underneath cards) */}
      <ConnectionLayer
        connections={connections}
        positions={conversationState.positions}
      />

      {/* Directly render thread cards as elements, not through a function */}
      {conversationState.items.map((conversation) => {
        if (!conversation.id) return null;

        // Get position data or use default
        const positionData = conversationState.positions[conversation.id] || {
          x: 100,
          y: 100,
          isCollapsed: false,
          isDragging: false
        };

        // Determine if this card is active
        const isActive = conversationState.activeConversation === conversation.id;

        // Get related connections for this card
        const cardConnections = connections.filter(
          conn => conn.fromId === conversation.id || conn.toId === conversation.id
        );

        return (
          <ThreadCard
            key={conversation.id}
            conversationId={conversation.id}
            notebookId={notebookId}
            position={positionData}
            isActive={isActive}
            isCollapsed={positionData.isCollapsed}
            isDragging={positionData.isDragging}
            conversation={conversation}
            connections={cardConnections}
            onDragStart={() => onDragStart(conversation.id)}
            onDragMove={(x, y) => onDragMove(conversation.id, x, y)}
            onDragEnd={() => onDragEnd(conversation.id)}
            onToggleCollapse={() => onToggleCollapse(conversation.id)}
            onToggleInfo={() => onToggleInfoDialog(conversation.id)}
            onEditContent={onEditContent ?
              (text) => onEditContent(conversation.id, text) :
              undefined}
            onContinueThread={onContinueThread ?
              () => onContinueThread(conversation.id) :
              undefined}
            onCreateFollowUp={onCreateFollowUp ?
              () => onCreateFollowUp(conversation.id) :
              undefined}
            onCreateReference={onCreateReference ?
              (targetId) => onCreateReference(conversation.id, targetId) :
              undefined}
            setIsModalOpen={setIsModalOpen}
            enableTextSelection={isTextSelectionEnabled}
            scale={scale}
            setSelectionMode={setSelectionMode}
          />
        );
      })}
    </Group>
  );
};

export default React.memo(TextLayer);

import { useRouter } from 'next/router';
import { useEffect, useState, useRef } from 'react';
import { useAuth } from '@/contexts/AuthContext';
import CanvasContainer from '@/components/canvas/CanvasContainer';
import { supabase } from '@/lib/supabaseClient';
import ErrorBoundary from '@/components/ui/ErrorBoundary';

export default function NotebookDetailPage() {
  const router = useRouter();
  const { id } = router.query;
  const { user, loading: authLoading } = useAuth();
  const [notebookExists, setNotebookExists] = useState<boolean | null>(null);
  const [isLoading, setIsLoading] = useState(true);
  const checkInProgressRef = useRef(false);

  // Check if the notebook exists for authenticated users - optimized to prevent multiple concurrent calls
  useEffect(() => {
    if (!id || typeof id !== 'string' || authLoading || checkInProgressRef.current) return;

    const checkNotebook = async () => {
      // Set flag to prevent concurrent calls
      checkInProgressRef.current = true;

      try {
        setIsLoading(true);
        console.log(`Checking notebook access: ${id}`);

        // For demo mode without authentication, we'll skip the server check
        if (!user) {
          console.log("Demo mode - skipping notebook existence check");
          setNotebookExists(true);
          setIsLoading(false);
          return;
        }

        // For authenticated users, check if notebook exists and user has access
        // Use an efficient query with only necessary fields
        const { data, error } = await supabase
          .from('notebooks')
          .select('id, is_collaborative, is_public, user_id')
          .eq('id', id)
          .maybeSingle();

        // User has access if they own it OR it's collaborative OR it's public
        const hasAccess = data && (
          data.user_id === user.id ||
          data.is_collaborative === true ||
          data.is_public === true
        );

        // Log access check results
        console.log('Access check result:', {
          notebookId: id,
          hasAccess,
          elapsed: Date.now() - performance.now()
        });

        if (error) {
          console.error("Error checking notebook:", error);
          setNotebookExists(false);
          return;
        }

        setNotebookExists(!!hasAccess);
      } catch (err) {
        console.error("Error fetching notebook:", err);
        setNotebookExists(false);
      } finally {
        setIsLoading(false);
        checkInProgressRef.current = false;
      }
    };

    // Execute the check
    checkNotebook();
  }, [id, user, authLoading]);

  useEffect(() => {
    if (!id || typeof id !== 'string' || !router.isReady) return;
    
    // Check if we have a card parameter
    const { card, x, y, _zoom } = router.query; // Prefixed zoom with underscore to satisfy ESLint unused var rule
    
    if (card && typeof card === 'string') {
      // We need to jump to a specific card
      // This will be handled in the CanvasContainer component
      return;
    }
    
    // Check if we have position parameters
    if (x && y && typeof x === 'string' && typeof y === 'string') {
      // We need to set the position
      // This will be handled in the CanvasContainer component
      return;
    }
  }, [id, router.query, router.isReady]);
  
  // Show loading state
  if (authLoading || isLoading) {
    return (
      <div className="flex items-center justify-center h-screen">
        <div className="animate-spin rounded-full h-10 w-10 border-t-2 border-b-2 border-blue-500"></div>
      </div>
    );
  }

  // Handle invalid notebook ID
  if (!id || typeof id !== 'string') {
    return (
      <div className="flex items-center justify-center h-screen">
        <div className="text-center">
          <h1 className="text-2xl font-semibold text-gray-800">Invalid Notebook ID</h1>
          <p className="mt-2 text-gray-600">Please select a valid notebook.</p>
          <button
            onClick={() => router.push('/notebooks')}
            className="mt-4 inline-flex items-center px-4 py-2 border border-transparent text-sm font-medium rounded-md text-white bg-blue-600 hover:bg-blue-700"
          >
            Back to Notebooks
          </button>
        </div>
      </div>
    );
  }

  // Handle case where authenticated user tries to access a notebook they don't own
  if (user && notebookExists === false) {
    return (
      <div className="flex items-center justify-center h-screen">
        <div className="text-center">
          <h1 className="text-2xl font-semibold text-gray-800">Access Denied</h1>
          <p className="mt-2 text-gray-600">You don't have permission to view this notebook.</p>
          <button
            onClick={() => router.push('/notebooks')}
            className="mt-4 inline-flex items-center px-4 py-2 border border-transparent text-sm font-medium rounded-md text-white bg-blue-600 hover:bg-blue-700"
          >
            Back to Notebooks
          </button>
        </div>
      </div>
    );
  }

  return (
    <ErrorBoundary
      fallbackComponent={({ error, resetError }) => (
        <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-100 p-4">
          <h2 className="text-xl font-semibold text-red-600 mb-2">Something went wrong!</h2>
          <p className="text-gray-700 mb-4">{error.message || 'An unexpected error occurred in the canvas.'}</p>
          <div className="bg-gray-200 p-4 rounded-lg mb-4 max-w-full overflow-auto">
            <code className="text-sm whitespace-pre-wrap">{error.stack}</code>
          </div>
          <button
            onClick={() => {
              console.log('Attempting to reset error state');
              resetError();
              window.location.reload(); // Force a full refresh
            }}
            className="bg-blue-500 hover:bg-blue-600 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded-md shadow-sm"
          >
            Try Again
          </button>
          <button
            onClick={() => router.push('/notebooks')}
            className="mt-2 text-blue-500 hover:text-blue-600"
          >
            Back to Notebooks
          </button>
        </div>
      )}
    >
      <CanvasContainer notebookId={id} />
    </ErrorBoundary>
  );
}

import { createContext, useContext, useEffect, useState } from 'react';
import { User, Session, AuthTokenResponsePassword } from '@supabase/supabase-js';
import { supabase } from '@/lib/supabaseClient';
import { useRouter } from 'next/router';

type AuthContextType = {
  user: User | null;
  session: Session | null;
  loading: boolean;
  signIn: (email: string, password: string) => Promise<AuthTokenResponsePassword>;
  signUp: (email: string, password: string) => Promise<{
    data: { user: User | null; session: Session | null } | null; 
    error: Error | null;
  }>;
  signOut: () => Promise<void>;
  resetPassword: (email: string) => Promise<{
    data: Record<string, never> | null;
    error: Error | null;
  }>; // Using Record<string, never> as a type-safe empty object
};

const AuthContext = createContext<AuthContextType | undefined>(undefined);

export function AuthProvider({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {
  const [user, setUser] = useState<User | null>(null);
  const [session, setSession] = useState<Session | null>(null);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
  const router = useRouter();

  useEffect(() => {
    let mounted = true;

    // Get initial session
    const getInitialSession = async () => {
      try {
        const {
          data: { session },
        } = await supabase.auth.getSession();

        // Only update state if component is still mounted
        if (mounted) {
          if (session) {
            setSession(session);
            setUser(session.user);

            // Set the global user ID for client-side reference
            if (typeof window !== 'undefined' && session.user) {
              window.supabaseUserId = session.user.id;
            }
          }

          setLoading(false);
        }
      } catch (error) {
        console.error('Error getting session:', error);
        if (mounted) {
          setLoading(false);
        }
      }
    };

    getInitialSession();

    // Listen for auth changes
    const { data: authListener } = supabase.auth.onAuthStateChange(
      (event, session) => {
        console.log('Auth state changed:', event);

        // Only update state if component is still mounted
        if (mounted) {
          setSession(session);
          setUser(session?.user ?? null);

          // Set or clear the global user ID
          if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {
            if (session?.user) {
              window.supabaseUserId = session.user.id;
            } else {
              window.supabaseUserId = undefined;
            }
          }
        }
      }
    );

    return () => {
      mounted = false;
      authListener?.subscription.unsubscribe();
    };
  }, []);

  // Sign in with email and password
  const signIn = async (email: string, password: string) => {
    return supabase.auth.signInWithPassword({ email, password });
  };

  // Sign up with email and password
  const signUp = async (email: string, password: string) => {
    try {
      const result = await supabase.auth.signUp({ email, password });
      
      // Note: We do NOT need to create a default folder here
      // The database trigger will handle this automatically
      
      return { 
        error: result.error,
        data: result.data?.user ? { user: result.data.user, session: result.data.session } : null
      };
    } catch (err) {
      console.error('Error in signUp:', err);
      return { 
        error: err instanceof Error ? err : new Error('Unknown error during signup'),
        data: null 
      };
    }
  };

  // Sign out
  const signOut = async () => {
    await supabase.auth.signOut();
    
    // Clear the global user ID
    if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {
      window.supabaseUserId = undefined;
    }
    
    router.push('/login');
  };

  // Reset password
  const resetPassword = async (email: string) => {
    return supabase.auth.resetPasswordForEmail(email, {
      redirectTo: `${window.location.origin}/reset-password`,
    });
  };

  const value = {
    user,
    session,
    loading,
    signIn,
    signUp,
    signOut,
    resetPassword,
  };

  return <AuthContext.Provider value={value}>{children}</AuthContext.Provider>;
}

export function useAuth() {
  const context = useContext(AuthContext);
  if (context === undefined) {
    throw new Error('useAuth must be used within an AuthProvider');
  }
  return context;
}

# Database Setup Guide

This document explains how to set up and fix database issues related to the Unified Canvas-Chat System.

## Issue Background

The application requires several database tables to function correctly:
- `cards` - Stores cards that appear on the canvas
- `threads` - Stores conversation threads
- `thread_messages` - Stores messages within threads
- `card_connections` - Stores connections between cards
- `parliaments` - Stores parliament data for collaborative features

When these tables are missing, you'll see errors like:
```
relation "public.cards" does not exist
relation "public.parliaments" does not exist
```

## Setup Instructions

### Option 1: Using the Supabase SQL Editor (Recommended)

1. Log in to your Supabase dashboard
2. Go to the SQL Editor section
3. Create a new query
4. Copy and paste the contents of the following files:
   - `supabase/migrations/unified_canvas_chat_system.sql`
   - `supabase/migrations/20250513105412_unified_card_thread_system.sql`
   - `supabase/migrations/20250512110000_parliament_responses.sql`
5. Run the query

### Option 2: Using Supabase CLI

If you have the Supabase CLI installed:

1. Make sure your project is linked to your Supabase project
2. Run the migrations:
   ```bash
   npx supabase migration up
   ```

### Option 3: Using Database Fix Scripts

1. First, get your Supabase service key:
   - Go to your Supabase dashboard
   - Navigate to Settings > API
   - Copy the "service_role" key
   - Add it to your `.env.local` file:
     ```
     SUPABASE_SERVICE_KEY=your_service_role_key
     ```

2. Run the database fix script:
   ```bash
   node tools/fix_database.js
   ```

## Manual Table Creation

If the automated methods don't work, you can manually create the essential tables:

### 1. Create the `cards` table:

```sql
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS cards (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  notebook_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES notebooks(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  thread_id UUID REFERENCES threads(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
  type TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'text',
  title TEXT NOT NULL,
  content TEXT,
  position JSONB NOT NULL DEFAULT '{"x": 100, "y": 100}'::jsonb,
  size JSONB NOT NULL DEFAULT '{"width": 300, "height": 200}'::jsonb,
  is_collapsed BOOLEAN DEFAULT false,
  is_dragging BOOLEAN DEFAULT false,
  z_index INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  style JSONB DEFAULT '{}'::jsonb,
  config JSONB DEFAULT '{}'::jsonb,
  user_id UUID REFERENCES auth.users(id),
  created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT now(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT now()
);
```

### 2. Create the `parliaments` table:

```sql
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS parliaments (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  notebook_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES notebooks(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  name TEXT NOT NULL,
  description TEXT,
  agent_count INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 3,
  config JSONB DEFAULT '{}'::jsonb,
  user_id UUID REFERENCES auth.users(id),
  created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT now(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT now()
);
```

## Common Issues

### Cannot Connect to Database

Make sure you have the correct environment variables set up in your `.env.local` file:

```
NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=your_supabase_url
NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=your_supabase_anon_key
SUPABASE_SERVICE_KEY=your_supabase_service_role_key
```

### Permission Denied Errors

If you see permission errors, ensure you are using the service role key (not the anon key) for running migrations and fix scripts.

### SQL Execution Errors

If you encounter errors when executing SQL, try running smaller portions of the SQL script to identify which part is failing.

## Support

If you continue experiencing issues, please reach out to the development team or create an issue on GitHub.

> ```

These are exactly the errors appearing in the console. The document also provides three ways to fix this issue:

The document also provides SQL statements to manually create the required tables if needed.

Specifically, the application is trying to query tables that don't exist in your Supabase database:

1. `relation "public.parliaments" does not exist`
2. `relation "public.cards" does not exist`

These errors occur because your application has been updated to use a unified Canvas-Chat system that requires new database tables, but those tables haven't been created in your database yet.

## How to fix it:

The DATABASE_SETUP.md document provides three ways to resolve this:

### Option 1: Using Supabase SQL Editor (Easiest method)
1. Log in to your Supabase dashboard
2. Navigate to the SQL Editor section
3. Create a new query
4. Copy and paste the contents of these migration files:
   - `supabase/migrations/unified_canvas_chat_system.sql`
   - `supabase/migrations/20250513105412_unified_card_thread_system.sql`
   - `supabase/migrations/20250512110000_parliament_responses.sql`
5. Run the query

### Option 2: Using Supabase CLI
If you're comfortable with command line:
```bash
npx supabase migration up
```

### Option 3: Using the fix script
1. Add your Supabase service key to `.env.local`:
   ```
   SUPABASE_SERVICE_KEY=your_service_role_key
   ```
2. Run:
   ```bash
   node tools/fix_database.js
   ```

After applying one of these fixes, refresh your notebook and the errors should disappear.

These errors are happening because the application is expecting database tables for the unified canvas-chat system that don't exist yet in your database. Once you create those tables using one of the methods above, everything should work correctly.
